result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony B Alexander

records.addlTxt: Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:47 AM Defendant Anthony B Alexander in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Attorney Klein requests to adjourn the matter until after his Milwaukee County Case as the pretrial offer in this case is conditioned on his plea in Milwaukee County.
The State does not object.
The Corut will allow the matter be set after his Milwaukee County Case.  Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 27, 2022 at 09:15 am.

11:17 AM Defendant Anthony B Alexander in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court notes that the Defendant had another matter in Milwaukee County and that is why he was late.
Attorney Klein states that the Defendant would like a prelim hearing.
Preliminary time limits waived.
The Court will adjourn.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Attorney Jessica Klein has been appointed to represent the defendant.

Status conference on May 13, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 16, 2022 at 09:15 am.

09:43 AM Defendant Anthony B Alexander in court.  Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant states he was evaluated by the Public Defender's Office and was found to be eligible for State Public Defender representation and that an attorney would be appointed.  The Court contacted the Public Defender's Office and they stated they did not have the defendant in their system.  The Court takes a short recess at 9:51 AM.  Matter recalled at 10:11 AM with the same appearances and Attorney Eryn Menden appearing with the defendant as a friend of the Court.  Time limits were previously waived.  The Court will schedule a preliminary hearing and a status conference date the day prior to verify an attorney has been appointed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 09:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.

03:02 PM Defendant Anthony B Alexander in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

02:21 PM Defendant Anthony B Alexander in court, in custody, with attorney Justin G Griffis.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
